page.title: 19Transport-Gleadless vicinity
page.content: Driver training- at the former aerodrome you have to be 15 years of age or more to use the tracks.It is open to any member of the public; you do not need a licence,insurance or "L" plates.It is not just for cars but motorcycles and lorries may also use it.About 500 vehicles use it each week which means that on occassions it can be more congested than the public highways.There is also a "skid-pan" course and the instructors also teach disabled children to handle cars.The site was recently jeopardised by an attempt by a large supermarket chainstore to obtain planning permission for the site. It was rejected.Public transport is a major issue:the cheap fares policy,which allows maximum travel for minimum cost,is under threat from centralised government.This is being resisted.
